Input.model1_summary1: A faulty electrical cable caused explosions at the University of Nairobi, causing students to panic and jump from a dormitory. One person died and hundreds were injured. The incident occurred less than two weeks after a terror attack by Al-Shabaab at a college in Garissa, Kenya. The university is working to repair the electrical issue and is urging students and the public to remain calm.

Input.model1_summary1: A New Jersey auction house has removed items from an upcoming event after facing backlash from the public. The items in question are crafts and artifacts made by Japanese-Americans who were confined to internment camps during World War II. The decision to remove the items came after a grass-roots campaign, including a change.org petition and involvement from actor George Takei. The auction house hopes this will spark a larger discussion about the sale of historical items related to human rights abuses.
Input.model2_summary1: A New Jersey auction house has removed items from its April 17 event after an uproar from the public.

Actor George Takei, who was also interned, helped mediate the removal of the items. The auction house hopes this controversy will spark a discussion about the sale of historical items related to human rights violations.

The Queensland police have established a joint taskforce with the RSPCA to investigate the industry and are appealing for anyone involved to come forward.

Input.model1_summary1: Australia has recalled its ambassador to Indonesia for consultations after two Australians were among eight drug smugglers executed by firing squad. The executions have strained the relationship between the two countries, with Australia condemning them as "cruel and unnecessary." The two men, Andrew Chan and Myuran Sukumaran, had been fully rehabilitated during their 10 years in prison, but their appeals for clemency were denied. The executions have sparked international outrage and calls for a moratorium on the death penalty.
Input.model2_summary1: The Australian government has recalled its ambassador to Indonesia for consultations after two Australians were executed by firing squad early Wednesday.

Input.model1_summary1: ISIS militants have seized control of the Yarmouk Palestinian refugee camp near Damascus, Syria. The camp is now trapped between ISIS and Syrian regime forces, with an estimated 18,000 refugees stuck in dire conditions. Aid agencies are struggling to provide assistance, and residents are facing the choice of fleeing or staying in a camp of death.
Input.model2_summary1: Besieged and bombed by Syrian forces for more than two years, the desperate residents of this Palestinian refugee camp near Damascus awoke in early April to a new, even more terrifying reality -- ISIS militants seizing Yarmouk after defeating several militia groups operating in the area.
Input.model1_summary2: ISIS has taken control of the Yarmouk refugee camp in Syria, causing chaos and terror for the residents. The camp is now caught in the middle of fighting between ISIS and the Syrian government, leaving thousands trapped and in desperate need of aid. The situation is dire, with limited access to food, water, and medical care, and residents are faced with the difficult decision of whether to stay and risk their lives or attempt to flee.

Input.model1_summary1: A quadriplegic man with cerebral palsy was found abandoned in the woods for four days. His mother, Nyia Parler, was arrested for leaving him there while she visited her boyfriend in Maryland. She cannot be extradited to Philadelphia until she completes unspecified treatment. The man suffered from dehydration, malnutrition, and a cut on his back. The investigation is ongoing to determine how he was cared for and what services were provided.
Input.model2_summary1: Nyia Parler can't be extradited until she completes treatment, police said Monday. The 21-year-old man was found "lying in leaves, covered in a blanket and a wheelchair nearby," police say. The man suffered eye problems, dehydration, malnutrition and a cut to his back, police say.
Input.model1_summary2: A quadriplegic man with cerebral palsy was found abandoned in the woods for four days in Philadelphia. His mother, Nyia Parler, was arrested in Maryland and cannot be extradited until she completes unspecified treatment. The man suffered from various health issues and his mother faces charges of aggravated assault and endangering another person. The investigation is ongoing.

The man was discovered by a passerby and suffered from dehydration, malnutrition, and other health issues. The mother, Nyia Parler, was arrested in Maryland and cannot be extradited until she completes treatment. She will face charges of aggravated assault and other offenses when she returns to Philadelphia. The investigation is ongoing to determine how the man was cared for and what services were provided.
